title: Housing Starts and Building Permits Seen Down — Data Week Ahead
text:
The following are forecasts for this week's remaining U.S. data from a survey compiled by The Wall Street Journal.

Forecasts were last updated on Monday afternoon.

DATE TIME RELEASE PERIOD CONSENSUS PREVIOUS (ET) Wednesday 0830 Retail Sales Sep +0.2% (21) +0.4% -- ex autos Sep +0.2% (17) +0.0% 1000 Business Inventories Aug +0.2% (12) +0.4% 1000 Housing Market Index Oct 68 (10) 68 Thursday 0830 Jobless Claims Oct 12 215K (14) 210K 0830 Housing Starts Sep 1.32M (19) 1.364M -- percent change Sep -3.2% +12.3% 0830 Building Permits Sep 1.33M (10) 1.419M -- percent change Sep -6.3% +7.7% 0830 Phila Fed Mfg Svy Oct 6.4 (10) 12.0 0915 Industrial Production Sep -0.2% (18) +0.6% 0915 Capacity Utilization Sep 77.7% (14) 77.9% Friday 1000 Leading Index Sep +0.0% (11) +0.0% (Figures in parentheses refer to number of economists surveyed.)

Write to Donna Huneke at dataweekahead@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 15, 2019 10:14 ET (14:14 GMT)
